group_1.textLeft: No, it's not that.
The picture book.
I used to really love that book.
Yeah.
It was before things went south for my dad.@Our family was really peaceful.
At some point I stopped being able to even@look at his books.
So I really don't remember much of them.
But this one book...I remember it so vividly!

group_1.textRight: What kind of book is it?

group_1.textLeft: Well, uh...
I don't remember.
I wouldn't even be able to tell you the@title.
But when I see the cover, it's like this@long-forgotten emotion wells up in my chest.
I feel like I recognize it.

group_1.textRight: So it must have been out a while ago.@Right?

group_1.textLeft: I guess.

group_1.textRight: And you really don't have it at home?

group_1.textLeft: I don't have any picture books anymore.
Not since my dad stopped writing them.
No, it's okay...really.
I can't stop thinking about that picture@book.

group_1.narration: "The Adventures of Dumpling Boy"...@I wonder why I couldn't leave it alone.
Had I ever felt this kind of curiosity for@any of the other books my dad wrote?
For as long as I can recall, my dad's@books were just parts of the past@I wanted to bury deep in my mind.@And yet...
That was when I made up my mind.

group_1.textLeft: These photos online are from Kamihama,@right?

group_1.textRight: That's what it says there, yeah.

group_1.textLeft: I want to go find it.

group_1.textRight: Hey, you shouldn't need to go all the way@to Kamihama for that.

group_1.textLeft: I already looked on all kinds of online@auction sites.
Nope.
But I can't get this book out of my head.

group_1.textRight: But it's not like there's any guarantee@you'll find a copy in Kamihama either.
I know! Did the person who uploaded those@photos buy the book?

group_1.textLeft: Looking at his latest posts, it seems like@he didn't.
He was upset about it, but he didn't have@enough cash.

group_1.textRight: What store was it at? Any idea where it@might be?

group_1.textLeft: I have no clue.

group_1.textRight: I guess you could ask the guy who posted it.

group_1.textLeft: I sent him a message, but I haven't gotten@a reply.
He hasn't posted anything lately, so it@might not be his main account.

group_1.textRight: That means you don't even have a lead!

group_1.textLeft: But I still want to go!
I can't explain exactly how this all makes@me feel, but...

group_1.textRight: Now that you're interested, you can't leave@it alone.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.

group_1.textRight: So when you gonna go look for it?

group_1.textLeft: Huh? Well, maybe on the weekend?

group_1.textRight: Cool! Then I'll go with you!

group_1.textLeft: What?!

group_1.textRight: I mean, come on, you got me all worked up@about finding this thing too.
Wow! That cake looks sooo good.

group_1.textLeft: Out of the question!
You just had pastries, didn't you? You're@eating way too many sweets!
And we've taken enough detours on this trip@already!

group_1.textRight: So that used bookstore, Natsume Books,@is around here?

group_1.textLeft: I think so.
No, I don't think so.
They seem to be famous in Kamihama for@their unique stock of books.
So let's start looking around here!
Looking at the address on the map, it should@definitely be close.

group_1.textRight: But it feels like we're just going around@and around in circles, doesn't it?

group_1.textLeft: Excuse me! Do you know Natsume Books?

group_1.textCenter: Natsume Books? Well, let me think.
